content.description: Start low on the left arete with hands on either side on low open holds. Post a foot and move up arete. Once you are in position, lunge out right to the "distant-ish" good jug out right for a fun move. Climb up and then traverse out to the right across the face to top out way right over the slab face.    (please dont try to climb up the fragile "chimney" feature, as this would be not only dangerous, but also damaging to the boulder and environment here. This goes for all lines on the boulder).

Start low on the blunt arete (same as per Jetson Right) and climb straight up and onto the face until you can snake over to the slabby face to the right to traverse over to a better top out in mid-slab-face.   (please dont try to climb up the fragile "chimney" feature, as this would be not only dangerous, but also damaging to the boulder and environment here. This goes for all lines on the boulder).

This is a nice lip traverse line. 

  Start on the furthest right portion of the lip of the boulder that you can. Traverse left to link into the Jetson lines, and then traverse back to the right to top out. Kind of silly but fun regardless... 

  (please dont try to climb up the fragile "chimney" feature, as this would be not only dangerous, but also damaging to the boulder and environment here. This goes for all lines on the boulder).
Start low, mid-face, under the steep overhang on a low matchable jug. Move up/right to good rails and then gain the lip. Top out over the slab.
Start as per "jetson" problems, but off of the start imediatly trend right across steep territory and thin holds. Link into "Galaxy" and finish as per.

This is a steep, detached boulder portion of the Galaxy Wall. There are several quality, challenging lines to be found here and all have a better landing than the majority of the Galaxy Wall. Good stuff!
